alert.note: Alert for Newaygo (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 31 at 2:13PM EDT until April 06 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Rapids MI has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Michigan... Muskegon River at Newaygo affecting Newaygo County. Muskegon River at Bridgeton affecting Newaygo County. .Several rounds of rain as well as some melting snow up near Houghton Lake will result in rising water levels on the Muskegon River over the next few days. Depending on exactly how much additional rain falls this evening, locations along the river near Newaygo and Bridgeton could reach minor flooding levels by Sunday and continue through early next week. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING TO LATE THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Muskegon River at Newaygo. * WHEN...From Sunday morning to late Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, The river starts exceeding its banks and minor flooding begins in low lying areas along the river. At 12.0 feet, Flood water begins surrounding cottages and homes downstream from the City of Newaygo in the area of Sycamore Flats in Ashland Township. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM EDT Friday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
